VLIB_mixtureOfGaussiansS16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_mixtureOfGaussiansS16 (const uint8_t *restrict Im, int16_t *restrict wt, int16_t *restrict mu, int16_t *restrict var, uint8_t *restrict compNum, uint8_t *restrict updateMask8, uint32_t *restrict Im_mask, const int32_t im_size, const int16_t alpha, const int16_t rho, const int16_t delta, const int16_t T, const int16_t ini_wt, const int16_t ini_var)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_mixtureOfGaussiansS16 ( const uint8_t *restrict  Im,
int16_t *restrict  wt,
int16_t *restrict  mu,
int16_t *restrict  var,
uint8_t *restrict  compNum,
uint8_t *restrict  updateMask8,
uint32_t *restrict  Im_mask,
const int32_t  im_size,

const int16_t  rho,
const int16_t  delta,
const int16_t  T,
const int16_t  ini_wt,
const int16_t  ini_var 
)

Description:
Maintain a Gaussian mixture model (GMM) for each pixel in a 16-bit video frame, and return a packed binary mask corresponding to the computed foreground regions for the input frame. This function assumes that the input stream contains a single channel (such as, luminance), and uses a maximum of 3 Gaussian components to model the pixel intensity variations.
Parameters:
[in] *Im Input image buffer (UQ8.0)
[in] *wt Buffer for current weights (SQ0.15)
[in] *mu Buffer for current means (SQ8.7)
[in] *var Buffer for current variances (SQ12.3)
[in] *compNum Buffer for indices indicating which mode a pixel belongs to (UQ8.0)
[in] *updateMask8 Buffer for internal use (UQ8.0)
[out] *Im_mask Computed binary foreground mask (32-bit packed binary)
[in] im_size Pixel count of input image buffer (SQ31.0)
[in] alpha Update rate for weights (SQ0.15)
[in] rho Update rate for heights (SQ0.15)
[in] delta Mahalanobis distance threshold (SQ4.11)
[in] T Background subtraction threshold (SQ0.15)
[in] ini_wt Initial weight for new component (SQ0.15)
[in] ini_var Initial variance for new component (SQ12.3)
Assumptions
  • If the input image contains N pixels, the input buffers should have the following sizes:
    • wt: 3.N data elements
    • mu: 3.N data elements
    • var: 3.N data elements
    • compNum: N data elements
    • updateMask8: N data elements
    • Im_mask: N/32 data elements
  • wt, mu, and var buffers should be initialized to 0 before invoking the function for the first time.
  • I/O buffers are assumed to be 64-bit aligned in memory.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
